newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh's Paragon leather company goes public.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh's Paragon leather company goes public.

text.p: Paragon Leather and Footwear Industries Ltd (PLFIL) has offered 60 million taka worth of ordinary shares of 100 taka each to finance its expansion programme, company officials said on Monday.

Subscription of the shares begins on April 6 and closes on April 15. PLFIL is an export-oriented joint venture company with International Schuh-Maschinen Trade and Service of Germany producing shoes and leather products, they said.
"We are expanding our market abroad every year," said one official.
"The purpose of the issue is to go to the general public and raise funds for the expansion and modernisation of existing projects," he added.

The officials said out of the 600,000 ordinery shares, 300,000 had been offered to the general public, 60,000 to the state-owned Investment Corporation of Bangladesh (ICB), 20,000 to company employees and 20,000 to non-resident Bangladeshis.
Besides, 200,000 shares have already been subscribed by three foreign investors including Peregrine Brokerage Ltd of Hong Kong.
